decision_conditions: The proposed development provides an uncharacteristic activity and inappropriate use in this established residential setting, which as a result of the activities associated with this use is detrimental to the character and appearance of the surrounding area contrary to Policies DC11 and DC61 of the LDF Core Strategy.

The proposal would, by reason of introducing of a general industrial use in such close proximity to residential properties create unacceptable levels of noise and disturbance to the detriment of residential amenity, arising from vehicle movements, and the general activities and processes associated with this uses. The proposal is therefore contrary to Policies DC11 and DC61 of LDF Core Strategy.

The proposal would, by reason of increased activity and parking of vehicles on the street adjacent to the site would result in unacceptable impact on the amenity of adjoining neighbours contrary to Policy DC11 and DC61 of LDF Core Strategy.

Statement Required by Article 35 (2) of the Town and Country Planning (Development Management Procedure) (England) Order 2015: Consideration was given to seeking amendments, but given conflict with adopted planning policy, notification of intended refusal and the reason(s) for it was given to the agent Mr Kniazev by email dated 03/09/2020.
description: Continued use of the site for car repairs (Class B2 use).
